bibl.seg: PEACOCK David and David WILLIAMS (Edd.), Food for the Gods. New Light on the Ancient Incense Trade. Illustrations edited by Penny COPELAND.
Oxford, Oxbow Books, 2007, 8°, xiv-151 pp., 1 front. coul., profils, graphiques, nombr. figg., cartes, plans. ISBN 978-1-84217-225-4. £35.
7 articles. - Pp. xiii-xiv: D.P. and D.W., Preface; - 1-3: D.P. and D.W., Introduction.

C.R. par Steven E. Sidebotham, JRA 20 (2007) pp. 628-630. - Alexis D'Hautcourt, The Kyoto Journal of Ancient History 8 (2008) pp. 79-86 [concerne aussi: David PEACOCK and Lucy BLUE (Edd.), assisted by Darren GLAZIER, The Ancient Red Sea Port of Adulis, Eritrea. Results of the Eritro-British Expedition 2004-5 (Oxford, 2007); - René J. CAPPERS, Roman Foodprints at Berenike. Archaeobotanical Evidence of Subsistence and Trade in the Eastern Desert of Egypt = University of California. Cotsen Institute of Archaeology. Monograph 55 (Los Angeles, 2006)].
